inn1.comm: nice start. Full and wide, just a hint of away movement. Pushed to point off the front foot. Confident start from both parties
superb shot but he finds the fielder at cover point. Too full - overpitched - outside off. A languid drive ensues
nice and straight, not much movement. Straight. Clipped away to midwicket to get SA running
nicely played again. Rather full outside off, de Kock strides forward and confidently drives to mid-off. Nice timing from both players, bodes well for batsmen
misses a full length. A low full toss outside off, drilled to mid-off.  A missed opportunity

finds the gap this time. But there is a fielder there. Maybe that's why Taylor bowls this full and wide, de Kock scythes one past point but sweeper cover cleans up. Not sure that's the best choice of strategy
too straight, and tucked off to square leg. A good length on de Kock's pads, worked away
swing. On a good length outside off, Amla opens up his bat face to guide this down to third man for one
overly full and straight, just hasn't quite found his lengths. Pushed to mid-on
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off
good single. Back of a length outside off, de Kock pushes to mid-off for a quick single. Hit it and ran, good batting
too straight again, Amla clips to square leg
lovely lines. Taylor switches to around the wicket and bowls it there, there being a good length on off. De Kock can do nothing but defend
a bit of width here. Good length outside off, de Kock looked to go finer by dabbing to third man but taps to point instead
slow short delivery. Offcutter. Steered to point again.
poor ball and smashed. An immediate apology from Taylor. Short and wide outside off, in de kock's cutting arc and he cuts. Past point and even a sweeper cover cannot stop the boundary
not sure what these tactics from WI are. Short and wide again outside off, chopped to cover. At least Taylor is bowling to his field
back of a length on middle, de Kock brings his angled bat down in typical fashion to block
superb shot from Amla. Overpitched outside off and smashed. A lovely straight bat and the off drive whistles past mid-off. Awesome
back of a length outside off, steered off the open face to third man. Better length to Amla
good run again. Tip and run. Back of a length on middle and leg, de Kock pats to point with soft hands. Gets one
good length. Nagging away on off, Amla hangs back to punch to extra cover
that is not a good delivery. Amla picks the slower delivery outside off, stays low and then lofts the cover drive intentionally over cover. Great execution
fullish on off, some inward shape. Amla closes up any possible gap between bat and pad, and blocks to mid-off
width again. Short and wide, dabbed to third man
very similar delivery but to the right-hander. Shortish and wide, another open-face steer to third man. Nice strike rotation
well bowled. Back of a length on off, cramps de Kock for room and duly defended
poor ball. Short and wide again, width to de Kock is never the best option. A bit of extra bounce, induced by a cross-seam delivery, takes the ball over de Kock's flaying bat
again. Short and wide, slapped to cover
nicely played. Overpitched outside off, de Kock lunges forward to caress his drive past cover. Sweeper cover scurries across to clean up
awful bowling from Holder. Ridiculous tactics these. Short and wide again, Amla shuffles across and nails the cut in the gap at cover. How can you bowl there to these two?
better, much better. Fullish on off, some shape in. Amla defends, bat close to pad. Impressive technique
129 kph, short but closer to off. Still plenty of width for Amla who tries to lace another cut but fails to connect. Unfathomable tactics these
130 kph outside off. Shortish length and open-faced to third man
full and wide outside off, de Kock drills a drive to mid-off who gets across and stops the boundary with a dive. Good fielding but bad bowling
slower ball on off, pushed to mid-off. A bit of cut on the slower ball
oh yes, Shot. Back of a length on off, Amla reads the length early, shuffles across, gets outside the line and pulls, keeps it down and gets the gap past short fine leg. That's just a good shot
even better. Shorter on off, this one sat up and Amla didn't disappoint. Swatted with disdain, past midwicket for four more. Sensational timing
three in a  row. Amla has a smile on is face and why not? Three beautiful shots. Overpitched outside off, a crisp, correct caress past cover off the full length.
just clever batting. Fullish again but the ball isn't there to hit so he opens the bat face and guide to third man
full on off, blocked off the front foot
smeared to mid-on. Full and wide outside off, de Kock comes forward but mis-times his drive
short and wide outside off to start, Amla walks across but misses a routine cut
slower outside off but short enough for Amla to thrash to cover
too short again, hasn't quite found his length. Shortish and smashed to mid-off
much much much better. Slower on off, a hint of turn. played away to square leg
nope, short and wide again, Amla won't keep missing. Goes back and rasps a cut past cover and past mid-off for four
much better. Shorter and slower but straighter, Amla shuffles across and works to deep midwicket
a good length delivery outside off, steered off the open face to third man
good length delivery but straying on the pads and worked away to square leg for a single
ooh, short and wide again. Another opportunity missed as Amla goes back but misses his leaden-footed square drive
good length outside off, dabbed to third man
excellent line. Probing on off and de Kock defends
drifting down leg and clipped away to square leg. Good from de Kock too, picking away anything loose
tossed up offbreak outside off, Qdk lunges forward to defend
a similar delivery. Pushed to cover
slightly shorter and wider, de Kock laces his cut but finds extra cover
and again. Some flight outside off, chopped to cover
straighter, flatter and quicker on middle. Punched to long-off
slower and wider outside off, pushed to long-on
good lines. Close to off and Amla can only defend
close but Amla was safe. Fullish and straight, pushed to mid-on and sets off for a quick single
superb shot from Qdk. Straight but a half-volley. De Kock on-drives with splendid timing and nobody is going to stop that. Amazing timing
crashed through the off side for one. A bit of width from Brathwaite
rubbish delivery. Short down leg, Amla helps it along and it looks destine for the fine leg boundary but Narine sprints across and stops it with one hand
slower delivery on off, smashed to square leg with a pull
oh my. How has he got it there? Amla manufactures two. Good length on a fifth-stump line, Amla opens up his wrists and flicks behind square to get two. Great batting
pulled for four more. Short on middle and leg, Amla needs some bat on it and that he gets. Rolls his wrists, keeps it down and finds the gap behind square
good length on off, tries to get it to third man but finds point this time
oh nice. Back of a length outside off, punched to deep cover for a couple. That's Amla's fifty, you won't see too many more fluent knocks
four more. Overpitched outside off, Amla open up his stance and hammers the straight drive past mid-off. He's going on and on, what stroke making
good comeback. A slower offcutter outside off, mis-timed to mid-off
full on off, drilled back at the bowler.
good stuff. Good length on off and de Kock defends solidly
short and wide, too much width. De Kock finds point with a superb cut stroke
some hesitation but all good. bunted towards mid-on, midwicket is lurking causing the doubt but a run is easily completed
nice shot. Back of a length outside off, glided to third man
nice. Quite full outside off and de Kock drives with splendid timing but finds mid-off
a misfield from Narine gives Amla four more. Fullish and wide, Amla drives beautifully towards mid-off where Narine gets across but sloppily lets it go through
back of a length outside off, guided to third man
slower delivery outside off, de Kock brings his angled bat down again and pushes to mid-off
shortish on middle, pulled down to fine leg. Keeps it down nicely
slower delivery outside off, steered to point
smeared to long-on. Shapes this one back towards middle and leg, driven
another open-faced dab to third man
de kock just struggling a touch but he is hanging in there. Full length, comes back in, hit back to the bowler
looks to cut but too close to him, Chopped to point off the wide offering
full and straight, driven to long-on
nice drive. Overpitched outside off, de kock comes forward and drills a drive to mid-off where Holder saves four with a dive
recurring theme. Short, wide, Amla opens his bat-face and steers to third man. Running out of adjectives for that dab
tossed up on off, pushed down to long-on
four more. Runs coming all too easily. de Kock gets low and sweeps this behind square. Straight ball but he connected
flatter and leg side-ish, worked to square leg
nicely played again. Short and wide, width. Amla uses the pace and guides this towards third man. Almost makes it to the boundary, too
tossed up outside off, driven off to cover
carrom ball on middle, clipped to short fine leg
good length on middle and leg, comes back in and hits Amla in front of middle and leg. A muted appeal because that was high
there it is again. A glide to third man off the open face
back of a length on middle and off, darts back in. Punched to cover
strays down leg, whipped to midwicket
overpitched on off, driven to long-on
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to deep cover
short and wide again, cut away nicely to deep point. 100 partnership, solid start
shortish but straight, de Kock backs away and laces his cut to point
crisp drive to deep cover off the full length
drifts down leg, carrom ball. Worked to short fine leg
overpitched outside off and clobbered to deep cover for a run
yorker outside off, jammed to cover
slow and drifts into the leg stump, Amla has a wafty flick and sends a leading edge rolling through mid-on
straighter ball on off, Qdk hangs back and dabs a single in front of the covers. Urgent single
full and heading down leg, that's a gift from Benn. Amla glances it fine past the keeper
tossed and angled in on middle, Amla answers with a wristy drive to long-off. Pretty...
Qdk steps forward and pushes this straight ball back to Benn
straying into the pads, and that's tickled through the square-leg region
floater outside off, Qdk comes forward and eases it through the covers
straighter one, skids off the surface, Amla camps back and whips it behind square
leg-stump ball, Amla is on the back foot as he tucks a single to midwicket
loopy offbreak outside off, drags the left-hander forward and snatches the outside edge. The sliced hit rolls to point
much fuller and aimed at off, pushed down to mid-off on the front foot
full enough for the sweep, straight in line, Qdk bends and sweeps a single to deep backward square leg
floated outside off, dabbed to short extra cover on the front foot
Qdk steps out to meet this full ball on middle, bunted to long-on for one
drops it short but Benn does not offer much room, chopped from off stump to backward point
hint of turn and bounce, Amla is indecisive, poking to point
this is a straight ball on off, driven crisply to long-off for one
width outside off, fraction short, Qdk slashes straight to short extra cover
slides on full and outside off, Amla runs it fine of short third man
tossed full on middle, Qdk shuffles forward and defends it back to Narine
slashed from outside off to the left of short extra cover. But sweeper has it covered
quicker and breaks in on off, Amla punches through the covers on the back foot
looks like a knuckle ball outside off, hit to deep cover again
full and straight, picked away to deep midwicket
Qdk steps out and is beaten by turn. He ekes out an inside edge to short fine leg. Benn held it back and disturbed the across-the-line swing
pushed shorter and quicker, helped to long leg
angled in and turns away, sliced drive to backward point
short and turns away outside off, Amla stands tall and forces a single to sweeper cover
lobbed outside off, de Kock calls for a single after gently tapping to point
darted short and outside off, cut away in the direction of sweeper cover
back of a length offcutter on off, whipped with the wrists to deep midwicket
full roller on off at 103ks, Qdk drops it in front of point
dug in short and outside off, Quinton de Kock rocks back and dismisses this offcutter over midwicket with a strong pull. Nailed that!
another cutter on middle and leg, dabbed to the midwicket region
full and cuts away wide outside off, Qdk plays early and ends up toe-ending a drive. The ball wanders away to long-off
back of a length and just a shade outside off, Amla has ample time to move back and across off. Flicked through square leg
drifts in and turns away slightly, carved past the covers
Qdk leans back to meet this shortish ball outside off. Cut away firmly through point. Backward point had no chance
Benn slows this up on off, Qdk dabs a single to the cover region and sets off. Amla responds
drifts in and turns away a bit, catches the outside edge and rolls to short third man
short ball, Amla stands tall and whips to short midwicket
flat and hurled wide outside off, slapped out to point
short and wide outside off, Qdk keeps back and chops it in the gap between backward point and short third man. Start converted into a fifty
full and straight, 106ks, pushed down to long-off
make it four dots in a row for Amla. Back of a length and on off, wafted to short extra cover
offcutter, 110.5ks, sticks in the surface. Amla checks his push and plays it back, riding the bounce
short legcutter, eased to sweeper cover
short and wide outside off, chopped out through cover point
floated full on middle, Qdk employs a reverse sweep and hits it fine of short third man. Four. Intent...
full and turns in, defended to the leg side on the front foot
Qdk shapes for another reverse sweep, this is pushed outside leg, reverse swept to backward point
tucked to backward square leg
short and turns away, punched serenely to sweeper cover.
full and spins in, worked to short fine leg
full roller on middle, blocked back to KP on the front foot
full offcutter stops on the batsman outside off, plays early and stabs through the covers
KP goes wide of the crease and gets it to swerve into the off stump, whipped out to midwicket with the twirl of the wrists
this one is pushed way way way wide outside off, first extra in the innings
Qdk reaches out and slaps a single through point
KP goes wide of the crease again and floats it outside off, chopped to point
quicker and fuller outside off, pushed to extra cover, where Benn fumbles, allowing a single
drifts in, too full on off, clipped to wide long-on. They aim for two. Have to settle with one in the end
full and turns in a touch, tapped to long-on
short and turns away outside off, cuts and top-edges in front of point
full and angled in, worked wide of midwicket. They push on for the second. Smat...
flighted and outside off, Amla caresses a drive to long-off and moves to 99
short and spinning into leg, pulled to deep backward square leg for one
full legcutter, worked to midwicket with soft hands for one
floated wide down leg
there it is! 23rd ODI ton! Classy innings, this. Amla stands outside leg, shuffles across off and eases it through point. Second ton of the tri-series, after Warner's 109
full cutter, leaves Qdk and finds the outside edge that rolls down towards mid-off
full and outside off, Qdk shuffles across off and drags a sweep to short fine leg, where the fielder fumbles
back of a length on middle, defended in front of point
loopy cutter swerves away from Qdk outside off, he flashes before the ball arrived. Beaten. KP throws a word or two at the batsman. WI are quite frustrated
full and turns away outside off, tapped away to sweeper cover
short and turns into the leg stump, swat-pulled to long leg
Benn whirls down a quicker one outside off, Amla is a tad late on the cut
full and drifts in, stops a touch on the batsman. Check-pushed to extra cover
turn and extra bounce, Amla goes back and edges a cut to short third man
full and straight on middle, blocked back to Benn
back of a length and cuts away outside off, stabbed to midwicket off the inside half
short and stops on the left-hander just a shade outside off, check-punched back to KP. To the right of KP, he makes a diving save
offcutter outside off, Qdk has a roundhouse swipe across the line and only connects with thin air
another one of those offcutters, Qdk goes hard at it and skews it back to KP
short and wide outside off, Qdk belts a cut to sweeper cover on the back foot
lovely uses of the wrists but straight to the fielder. Whipped from off stump to midwicket
tennis ball bounce outside off, possibly the offcutter, left alone
full and angled in from round the stumps, bunted back to the bowler
full and swerves in at the legs, whippy drive to long-on

ah, fancy scoop! Was that better than Cook's? I vote for Amla! He shuffles across and gets a full ball outside off. He went a long way across off, but still scooped it away to fine leg for four. Nifty wristwork
full and outside off, Amla has a big slash and sends an outside edge to left of third man, beats the fielder's slide in the deep
leg-side wide, cutter gone wrong
half-volley outside off, driven to long-off

Pollard finds a way past the opening pair, has Amla skying a catch to long-off. He rolls his fingers across this full offcutter. Barely 100ks. Amla aims to launch it over the fielder. No dice. He slices it and finds Narine. End of a fine, fine effort. Dolly catch
quicker one down leg, clipped to square leg
that was cutting down leg but Morris works off his pads to short fine leg
fullish on middle and leg, nurdled to square leg again
Pollard jumps out wider of the crease and fires a full yorker outside off which is squeezed out to cover
full toss down leg, de Kock misses out and he is hit on the pads outside the line. May have been an inside edge too. A run to square leg anyway

bowled im. De kock has struggled and struggled and he is now gone. Taylor goes wider of the crease from around the wicket and bowls a yorker on off. The ball is quick and hustles under the bat of de Kock. Uproots off stump and WI are fighting back here
full on off and middle, Faf strides forward and skews one onto his pads. The pair get a run to point
nice shot. Overpitched outside off, Morris leans forward and drives with nice timing, past cover. Benn, at mid-off, backtracks to field
excessively full and wide outside off, Morris cannot connect with an attempted cut
Taylor oversteps and gives SA a free run. Driven into the cover region for a run. Long stride from Taylor, just over, but over
four. Quite a high full toss outside off, Faf is surprised slightly and has a swing but misses. Bounces behind the pitch and skids off, scoots and goes through Ramdin's pads. Good result for SA
strays down leg again, nurdled towards backward square leg where Narine fumbles and allows the second run.

six. Shot. Treats it like an offspinner, Morris runs at the offcutter, picks it up early and then lofts the ball over long-on. Wait, that is an awesome shot. He timed that beautifully, didn't over-hit that, straight bat. High quality
a bit of a slog, but two more. Slightly shorter and wider outside off, swatted to deep midwicket
rubbish delivery. Slower delivery down leg, Morris waits and waits and then pulls behind square for four. nicely played
ooh, opened up. That was an offcutter on leg, Morris gets a thick outside edge which races away towards the third man boundary. Benn labours after it
good batting. Just pushes it to cover for one, knows there are plenty of the over
that should be wide and is called. Another extra. Full and wide outside off, outside the tramline and called
yorker to finish. Jammed back to the bowler
cracked away. Full and wide, hammered past cover for a couple. Not exceptionally timed and so sweeper cover gets around
oh yes. Morris improving his batting credentials. A wide yorker outside off, Morris opens the bat face late and gets it very fine, to the third man boundary. Nice.
another improperly timed drive to cover for a run
worked away behind square nicely for another brace. Faf has done this well, calm head
no ball again. Very poor from JT. Low full toss on middle and leg, hit to cover for one.
nicely bowled. Speared in the blockhole on off, jammed to cover. Good comeback under pressure, but put himself in that position
full and wide, hurried for pace slightly but manages a mis-timed drive to cover
shortish on off, turning back in. Punched to cover off the back foot
nudged to square leg/midwicket region. Faf sends his partner scurrying back
tossed up on leg, whipped to square leg for one
Morris gets low and pulls this short delivery to deep backward square leg
whoa, what happened there? Tossed up outside off, Faf tries to cut but plays way over it. Missed it by some distance
flat offbreak to finish on off, Faf defends. Well played by SA, maybe two runs short in that over
full and wide outside off, Morris shuffles across, gets low and misses his attempted scoop. Planted his pad outside the line of off, good batting
what was he doing? Totally needless. Slower ball outside off, slapped back at Brathwaite who turns around and misses at the bowler's end. Faf's bat was firmly in the crease, concedes an extra
back of a length on middle and leg, a hurried flick to short fine leg
strays down leg and Morris whips it away towards square leg. The fielder has to scamper across from midwicket and stops it with the boot, Darren Bravo
legcutter outside off, drilled down to long-off
short and wide offcutter, smashed to deep cover for one
short but straight, du Plessis flicks past midwicket and immediately calls "two, two". Morris comes back, well done
overpitched, over-flighted on off, pushed to long-on
strays in line, goes down leg and Morris sweeps towards backward square leg for a couple. Played that nicely too
flat on leg, solidly defended
more flight outside off, Morris strides forward to defend, intent on playing him out
flat outside off to finish, Morris hangs back and defends
fullish on leg from wide of the crease, pushed to long-on
phew, what a shot. Slower offcutter outside off, Morris stands tall and swats the ball mercilessly for a flat six over wide midwicket. Sensational timing

taken this time. Morris goes but he plays a really good innings here. Slower legcutter outside off, Morris looks to put this in the stands over midwicket again but skews it off the outside half. Lobs up and midwicket comes in to take a safe catch. Quite a special innings that
full and wide outside off, some late swing. Outside-edged to short third man
full and wide, driven sweetly to deep cover
slower legcutter on middle, pushed back to the bowler who fields well in his follow-through
tossed up outside off, Ab works this to midwicket
flat again outside off, pushed back to the bowler. Clear intent to play him out
clipped towards Pollard at midwicket who saves the run with a dive
oh shot. Slighlty shorter and wider outside off, AB rushes back to punch through cover for a couple. So quick on that length
too full and wide, driven to cover
some flight on off, another offbreak, nudged to midwicket. Another tidy over
full and straight, de Villiers goes back and hits it back to the bowler
legcutter on off, a thrashy cut to deep point
slower offcutter outside off, mis-timed to cover. Holder picks up and cheers his bowler on with a clap
and again. But a lazy fumble allows the run. Another offcutter outside off is hit to cover. Holder lets this go
AB scurries across outside off, looking to ramp but slices the full toss well outside off to backward point
chops this past point for a couple. Really good over, just four off it
flat and wide, tapped to point with soft hands for a quick run
beaten in flight. Sees AB coming and shortens the length, the ball spins into AB's pads, a run to third man
flat on off, defended
tossed up outside off, swatted to midwicket. Another dot ball. Pressure building
slogged this time for four. Some flight and turn on middle, Faf backs away and sweeps over midwicket. Just over. Four.
the carrom ball to finish on middle, Faf plays it as late as possible, allows it to turn and works to square leg
there you go. Immediately. full and wide outside off, du Plessis comes down and carves the ball in the gap between backward point and short third man. Well played
full on off, hit to cover. Dot.
same shot, same gap, same result. Full and wide outside off, du Plessis looks to go over cover but the ball skews off the outside half, four to third man again
full toss outside off, pushed past cover for a couple. Exceptional running. Brathwaite has his arms up and lets out a cry of "come on".  Samuels the man
overpitched outside off, looking for the yorker. Hit to cover
full toss outside off, scythed to deep cover for one
full and drifting into the pads, AB clips it to deep midwicket
full toss on middle, Faf can't quite get under it. Pushed to long-on
low full toss outside off, flat-batted to long-off
wild swing, four. Wanted to hit that over midwicket or wide on-on but it goes in a 180 degree opposite direction. thick outside edge flies over the keeper for four
smashed for six. Holder was looking for the yorker but missed his length. A low full toss on leg is smashed over midwicket.
yorker on middle and leg to finish, smeared to long-on for one
superb shot. A legcutter outside off, Faf tries to go over fine leg but the ball is way too wide outside off, so he improvises a scoop over the keeper for a couple
tries again. Walks way across to ramp, Brathwaite fires it full and wide outside off, Faf checks an improvised scoop to third man
golf swing for six. Legcutter on middle and off, AB waits, waits, waits and then swats it  over long-on. What a clean swing.
tries to york AB, doesn't execute to perfection but smears to long-on
shortish and wide outside off, slapped to cover for a run
full and wide, on a fifth/sixth-stump line. AB looked to get under that but failed to, but he hit it so hard past the bowler that it reaches the long-off boundary in no time. Expensive over
slower ball on leg, clipped to short fine leg. Fifty for Faf, when did he get here? Quality from Faf. Unnoticed.
whoaaa. 1845-metre hit that. Slower ball on leg, AB backs away, clears his front foot and boom. Heaved way over midwicket.

mis-timed this and taken. AB goes. Slower ball on middle, bounces a bit extra, which was probably responsible for the ball bouncing more. AB looked to hit that over midwicket again but skews it off towards long-on, who takes a god catch running to his left
another cutter on middle and leg, pushed into the gap at midwicket but just one
another cutter outside off, skewed to deep cover for one
shortish and wide, slapped to cover, just one. Good comeback from Pollard
smashed. Huge six. Full on middle, would du Plessis have liked it anywhere else? Clears his leg and Faf goes straight. Lofts it clean and straight, way over long-on
carved over point this time for four. Almost finds the yorker outside off, but du Plessis backs away and slices it for four
full and wide outside off, slapped towards deep cover. Mis-timed so badly that they get two. Great batting
slower, short delivery on leg. Du Plessis gets on top of it and slaps to deep square leg. Just one more
another slower delivery outside off, JP chops this to the keeper for a run
another yorker but that is exceptional batting to convert a yorker into a boundary. Speared in on leg stump, faf backs away and drills it past the stumps and into the long-on boundary. Great
six more. JP runs to the slower ball, almost gets to the pitch and then lofts the ball comfortably over long-off. Another six.
shortish and wide, cross-batted cut to deep point
slower short delivery on leg, Faf goes deep in his crease but checks his swat towards midwicket and gets two.
yet another slower delivery outside off, Faf gets low and tries to scoop but misses. Struck outside the line and a leg bye ensues
slower delivery again outside off, hammered to long-off. Just the one again
slower on leg and middle to finish, smeared to midwicket and a fumble from the fielder gives the pair two to finish

inn2.comm: Parnell runs in hard and hits the deck harder. Prancing short ball on the leg stump, tentatively fended behind square for one
140ks, short and wide, angling away from over the stumps, the opener has a slash and skews it to the covers
short and stops on the batsman, played back
short and sliding down leg, Charles uses the pace of Parnell and helps it on its way
back of a length and angled away, dabbed to point with an open face
dug in short and angled away outside off, cut behind point for four
left alone outside off
short and hustles in on off, mis-times a pull to midwicket
back of a length and outside off, helped down to third man
back of a length and outside off, the batsman uses the pace of Rabada and steers it past backward point again. Delicate touch
leg-side wide
short and width, cut to the covers
much closer to the off stump, glided straight to backward point
back of a length and outside off, slapped in the gap at covers
inducker, wafted to the leg side off an inside edge
back of a length and closer to the off stump, he clears his front leg and swings it to mid-off
back of a length on middle, Charles shimmies out and clubs it over midwicket. What's more? Parnell has overstepped

low full toss, swerves in on the leg stump, the batsman swings it straight down the throat of long-on. Yikes, Parnell has overstepped by a substantial margin, again. He has to re-bowl it. AB has a word with the bowler
overpitched on the leg stump, Parnell misses the yorker, clears the front leg and biffs the free hit to the right of long-on. Drilled away fiercely
fraction short on off, slugged away to the midwicket boundary
dropped a bit short and outside off, Charles flays another cut past backward point for four
short-arm jabs this back of a length ball behind square
Rabada replies with an inswinging yorker, Fletcher backed away and was followed by Rabada. Hustles past the leg stump
bouncer on the leg stump, ducked under
another crackin' inswinging yorker on leg, jammed out to midwicket
full and straight, hangs back and whips behind square for a couple
angled in full from round the wicket, the length is not so short to cut. Slashes and misses
inswinging yorker on off from round the stumps, squeezed out
short and angled into the hips, helped to fine leg
back of a length and angled in, clears the front leg and swats it in the air. Out of reach of the diving Faf at mid-on
yorker on off, squirted to the leg side
down the track, gets a full toss, and jabs to mid-off
back of a length on the middle stump, Fletcher clears his front leg and slogs over midwicket. Raises the fifty stand with that wild hit
Rabada goes short, bouncer on leg, ducked under. Wide called for line
pitched up on off, shovelled to mid-on
146.3 inswinging yorker topples the batsman, but he squirts behind square
away-cutter, the opener chases with his feet nailed to the crease. Beaten
rising short ball on off, hustles on at 146ks, Charles is late on the hook but top-edges a six over fine leg
145.2ks yorker on off, pushed to mid-off
skids on outside off, bunted to the covers
slider on outside off and turns away, beating the cut. Some extra bounce there as well
another full ball skids on middle and leg, dabbed to square leg
might have been a googly, down the track and gets an inside edge onto the pad. Tahir has his hands on his head
lobs a middle-stump full toss, tapped down the ground
floated on off, Fletcher bends forward in defence. That's the first boundary-less over of the innings
Short and wide outside off from over the wicket, cut to backward point
pushed to mid-off

down the track and gets a full ball that is laced ram-rod straight down the ground, so much so he sends one of the stumps cartwheeling at the non-striker's end. The stump is broken. Almost spears ump Brathwaite. Charles drilled that with all his might
full and heading down leg, wide. WI conceded the first extra in the 28th over. Ill-discipline from SA
dug in short, slog-pulled to deep square leg
Fletcher gets on top of a short ball outside off and lashes a cut to point
inducker follows the batsman who was stepping out and backing away. Awkwardly fended to the off side
googly, zips in and takes the pad, but heading down leg
nudged off the pads to square leg
flighted full ball on off, swiped away over midwicket. The googly is swung away. Charles held nothing back there
flicked to square leg
looped up on off, defended on the front foot

swung away... into the hands of deep midwicket. It dips, dips, FB dives forward and plucks out a smart low catch. Tahir finds the breakthrough and sets off on a celebratory sprint. Fletcher is asked to wait. It looks a nice, clean catch. Fletcher has to go. Straight ball on off, no turn, swiped to FB
short on off, swatted away behind square on the leg side
back of a length and leaves Bravo outside off, skirts past the outside edge
overpitched and outside off, Bravo flows forward and drives it on the up, creaming it between the covers and mid-off
left alone outside off
full and angled in at the base of off, jammed out to short extra cover
sharp bouncer, ducked under
spins in on off, jabbed to the leg side
spins in on off again, pokey drive to long-on off the inside edge
too full and spins in, whipped through midwicket
down the track and driven back to the wristspinner
skiddy ball on the legs, clipped through square leg on the back foot
Bravo bends forward to smother any spin
good length and angled in, defended
full, too full, punched to mid-off
full and glides it to backward point, there is a mix-up in the middle. JP dives but the ball bobbles out. SA don't capitalise on the run-out chance

full and angled in from round the stumps, the left-hander dabs a single in front of cover and sets off. A direct hit could have had Bravo. JP the man missing the run-out chance again. Bravo made life difficult for himself by running from one side of the wicket to another. Could have rushed off in a straight line
full and curls in on middle, jabbed to midwicket
short and angled in, pulled to deep midwicket
full and spins into the right hander, flicked to short fine leg
spinning down leg, brushes the thigh pad on its way to Qdk
flatter and quicker on off, whipped to wide long-on for two
tossed on off and rips away outside off, past the outside edge. Extra lift on the googly. The batsman had no clue

Charles fell for 48 last match. He falls for 49 this match. Shamsi leaps for joy. No signs of the bus-driver jig yet in the tri-series. The batsman stepped out. Shamsi held this googly back outside off. Down the track and sliced into the lap of Faf at long-off
skids on full, middle-stump line, defended off the back foot
cutter outside off, induces the edge, does not carry to slip
worked to short midwicket. FB swoops on it and attempts a direct hit with one hand. Misses it by some way. Bravo has another close shave
too full on middle, driven down the ground
jags back in, back of a length, wafted in the direction of mid-on
short and angled in, tucks Bravo up for room. Blocked gingerly to the covers
angling into the hips, helped towards fine leg
drifts in and spins away, poked to point
quicker one, spins back into the left-hander, wrong'un, punched back
short and turns away outside off, slashed down to third man
slider on middle, poked out
terrific bowling. Tossed on off and leaves Samuels outside off, drags him forward and topples him over. Beaten by the wrong'un
sharp turn back into Samuels, full in length, prodded back to Shamsi
full and outside off, eased to sweeper cover
back of a length and angled in, guided behind square on the leg side
Bravo flows forward to meet this length ball outside off. Driven stylishly to sweeper cover
Parnell goes wide of the crease and sends down a cutter. Samuels had a big whoosh at it, nearly kissed the off stump
overpitched outside off, drilled to mid-off. AB releases the ball quickly but misses the direct hit. Samuels dives full-length
Parnell rolls his fingers across this. Offbreak, 128,3ks, gets Bravo and leaves WI three down. Swerves in slow at Bravo and sneaks through the gate. He is already through with his swing. Timbaaah!
flat on middle, some sharp turn into Samuels who punches to long-on
flight down leg, worked to fine leg but just the one
shortish on off, Samuels rocks back and punches to deep cover
the googly on off and middle, Ramdin strides forward to defend
flat and short outside off, extra bounce. Ramdin misses his cut. Good tight bowling this
flat outside off, smeared to midwicket. Tidy over
full and wide outside off, Samuels chooses to let this one go
fullish and wide outside off, chopped to point. Another dot, these building up consistently
shortish outside off, Samuels hangs back to punch to mid-off. Another dot ball
overpitched on off, Samuels opens the bat face to guide towards deep cover
slower ball on off and middle, 124 kph. Pushed back to the bowler. WI falling behind
shortish and wide, chopped in front of point for one. Just two singles of the over
starts with a flat legbreak on middle, a thick inside edge of the flat delivery
low full toss outside off, swept away to square leg
the googly. Outside of, swerving back in. Samuels plays it late, chops to third man
tossed up on off, driven to long-on
flat on off, defended towards point
another googly outside off, this one jags back into Samuels who is beaten all ends up as the ball thuds into his pad outside the line of off
overpitched outside off, driven to mid-off
direct hit and out. Samuels started late, fatally late. Good length delivery on off, Ramdin pats one towards Behardien at cover who hustles to the ball but misses the stumps at the batsman's end
fullish on off, Samuels tries to blast one down the ground but mis-hits to long-off
slower ball on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket. 130 kph
short, wide, cut away, four. too much width from Parnell, Ramdin laces it past point and it whistles to the boundary
nagging line outside off, Ramdin defends to point
full and flat outside off, crisply driven to deep cover for a brace
cut away past third man and Samuels gets four. Flatter delivery outside off, Samuels opens the bat face and guides the ball past slip. Rabada puts in a dive but cannot stop the boundary
four more. Scratch that. I only have to. Short and wide outside off, cut past point again. Shamsi runs across from deep cover and puts in a boundary-saving dive.
the googly outside off, Ramdin shaped to sweep but improvised a block
flat on off, pushed to long-on
slower legbreak outside off, Samuels opens his face to guide to short third man. Better over for WI
uh oh. Flat down leg and five free runs. Everyone, including me, thought it was the googly because it started so well down leg. It was the legbreak and continued further down. Qdk had no chance
flatter outside off, nudged towards midwicket
chops on, almost. Flat again outside off, turns back in. Inside-edged onto the body
the legbreak down leg, nudged to square leg
good use of the feet, runs to the pitch and then drives to long-on

easily taken. This time it is the googly, and extracts extra bounce as a result. A little short down leg, Ramdin tries to pull but fails to keep it down. A thick top edge as a result and the ball lobs off to backward square leg where Morris runs in and completes an easy reverse-cupped catch
flat on off, defended
the tossed up googly outside off, Pollard looks to go over cover but smears to long-on instead
another googly outside off, Samuels doesn't pick it. Flays a drive but gets a thick inside edge to fine leg
flat on off, driven to cover
clean hit for six. Nice batting. Runs to the pitch and even though it is a googly, he doesn't care because he smothers the spin and drills a flat six over long-on

six and out. Tahir has 100 ODI wickets, the fastest South African, fourth-fastest overall. Shortish and wide outside off, the regulation legbreak. Samuels hangs back and tries to cut but gets a thick outside edge which is well held by de Kock. Had his gloves in the right position. A loose shot from Samuels

googly to start. Spun so much that is would have spun down leg. Flat on middle, Holder strides down and tries to block but is rapped on the pads. Easy decision for the umpire. SA don't want the review, good call
flat on middle, Pollard closes his bat face to hit to square leg
flat down leg again, off the pad into the leg side
another flat legbreak on middle, inside-edged on the bounce to short leg
short down leg, easily worked to square leg
shortish on off, stops in the surface a little and Holder bunts it back
the googly outside off to finish. Tapped towards point
flat outside off, Pollard defends
slider outside off, punched back to the bowler
too flat again, outside off. Punched to long-off
another googly on off, driven to long-off
ooh, the googly. Pollard was looking to go over midwicket but has to improvise a block
too flat down leg, clipped towards square leg. Some hesitation but only one as Pollard sends Holder back just in time
too full on middle, so Pollard tries to go down the ground but inside-edges to fine leg
flat and slides down leg for an extra run
nicely bowled. Slowed it up nicely on off, Pollard defends. Hit or block from Pollard so far
the googly this time outside off, Pollard tries to defend but is convincingly beaten
short on leg, worked away to deep midwicket
flat outside off, pushed towards point
a googly to finish outside off, Holder stands tall and defends
ooh, some tail back. Fullish on middle, shapes back in. Pollard pushes to long-on.
full outside off, pushed to cover
sent back late. Full and wide outside off, jammed to point. Behardien at point misses the stumps at the batsman's end and concedes the overthrow. Was off balance
back of a length outside off, Pollard stands tall to defend
short delivery outside off, 140 kph. Pollard sways out if the line
slower ball on middle and leg, worked towards midwicket for one
starts with a leg side-ish delivery which is nurdled to midwicket
nicely played. Opens the face of this full delivery to carve past point
low full toss on off, hit back to the bowler
too straight and whipped to deep square leg. Some definite late inward movement
ooh, chipped back, past the bowler, for a run to long-off. Checks his drive and just out of reach of Morris. Long-on comes around to field
slower delivery outside off, pushed to point. Another dot, way too many in this partnership
another full toss on off, pushed to cover. Looking for that yorker but misses his length
another full toss on middle, smeared to midwicket. Two dot balls of full tosses.
slower delivery on leg, clipped to fine leg
nudged to fine leg again off the straight line
short, wide. Cut away for four. Holder stood tall and punched it nicely, behind point.
another full toss, the third of the over. Outside-halved to third man. Better over for WI
nice change-up. Short delivery on middle, jagging back in. Gloved to midwicket. Holder seems to have injured a finger
strays down leg, Holder clips behind square for a brace. Would have been wide had he let it be
a late, dipping slower ball outside off. Full toss, steered to third man. Short third man
ooh, full on middle, almost goes through but inside-edged to square leg. Pronounced movement.
worked to midwicket for a quick single. Pollard makes it easy with those massive strides
fullish outside off, hit to long-off for a run. Five off it, not a bad over for WI but they need a tad bit more
full outside off, Holder stands tall and defends
full toss on middle, driven to long-on
slower ball outside off, Pollard tries to open the bat face but the all goes past
looking for that yorker again, slides down leg but Pollard jams his bat down just in time
short delivery outside off, Pollard fails to connect with a pull
drifts down leg, full toss. Pollard misses his flick and is struck flush on the pads down leg, a scampered leg bye
126.5 kph on middle and leg, pushed to long-on
good length on off, patted to point. Another dot ball
fullish and wide, Holder backs away and slaps the ball over cover for a brace. Better intent at least
strays down leg, skewed to short fine leg
legcutter outside off, Holder tries to dab to third man but misses. Yet another dot
splendid delivery. A forced dot. Exceptional bowling. Speared in the blockhole and jammed out
flat but strays down leg for an extra run
there you go. Too full on off, Pollard doesn't need to bother picking the delivery because it is so full. Smashed over long-on. Massive six.
flatter on middle, shorter. Worked to square leg, Good batting
overpitched outside off, pushed down to long-off for one
overpitched on leg, wristily powered to deep midwicket
a flat delivery down leg, Holder tries to play through the leg side but a thick edge to cover
nicely played. Gets behind the googly and punches to long-on with a straight bat. Good over for WI

gone. Plumb in front. Absolutely no worries about that. Flat delivery on middle and leg, Holder tries to reverse lap but he misses it by some distance. The ball hits him flush in front and the umpire gives him. Plumb as they get.

cleaned 'em up! Tahir sets off on another celebratory run! He blows kisses as well. Somebody catch him! He greets Carlos with a zippy googly. The new man heaves across the line and misses. The furniture is rattled
whirls down a quicker slider outside off, Narine pushes outside off and gets beaten
worked through the midwicket region
wrong'un, drifts in, Pollard aims for a flick across the line and is rapped on the pad. Heading down leg

rank long-hop and Tahir takes a five-for! Three wickets in the over. He sets off again. Dropped way short and outside off, Pollard skips back and pulls. Hits it straight to FB at deep midwicket. This is a simpler catch for FB
spinning down leg, helped off the thigh to fine leg for four. Shamsi errs in line and pays the price as the googly goes wrong
full and spins away outside off, heave and a miss
loopy one turns away outside off, Narine flashes a drive and nicks it.... Flies off the gloves of Qdk, beats a leaping Amla at slip as well for four
shorter and outside off, flapped past midwicket for two
tossed on middle, driven to long-off
fired full on middle, dug back to Shamsi
googly outside off, Narine prods and is defeated
sliding on the pads, clipped through square leg
Make that a six-wicket haul for Tahir. No celebrations this time. Wrong'un outside off. Benn reaches out and slices a drive to Shamsi at backward point
dragged short on middle, punched down the ground
poked to backward point
lobbed up outside off, swung away to long-on. The fielder, Faf, runs in, and lets it through for four
length ball on middle, clubbed over midwicket. Good ol' slog from the No.11
dug in short and wide outside off, this is a proper cut past backward point for four
full and tails in, defended back to the bowler
yorker on middle, dug out down the ground
short rising ball on off, top-edged pull over square leg
banged in and swerving away outside off, Narine sways his upper body out of the way
googly, comes in, and nearly takes the leg stump. No.11 swings and misses, Qdk is beaten as well
flat and full on middle, whipped to long-on
short legbreak outside off, chopped to covers on the back foot
looks like another googly, Taylor slogs and takes it on the thigh
googly goes wrong! Dragged down on middle, rocks back and drums a pull over midwicket

Tahir becomes the first SA bowler to take seven wickets in an ODI. South Africa earn a bonus-point win and go top of the points table. The legspinner plucks out a stump as souvenir. Slider at 94ks, breaches the defences and nails the stumps. Taylor played back and watched it shoot a bit low
